revised_title: A Unique Case of Calculi Passage Through a Fistulous Sore in the Loins
tldr: The case study presents a patient who passed kidney stones through a fistulous sore in the loins without any concomitant urine discharge. The patient experienced pain and inflammation, followed by the extraction of calculi from the wound. This case demonstrates the remarkable power of nature and the rarity of such occurrences.
